description: {"blocks":[{"key":"elkik","text":"Any commonly used size selection technique (e.g., the double-sided size selection described here, or an electrophoretic","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs83m","text":"method) may be integrated into the KAPA HyperPlus library construction workflow. Size selection should preferably be","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37b7s","text":"carried out after the post-ligation cleanup, or after library amplification. Whether or not size selection is performed, which technique is used, and at what stage of the library construction process it is performed, depends on the nature of the sample, input into library construction, and the sequencing application and read length. For more information on size selection, refer to Important Parameters: Size Selection (p. 7).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftvo2","text":"The workflow combines enzymatic steps and employs minimal bead-based cleanups, thereby reducing sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl475","text":"handling and overall library preparation time to 1.5 â€“ 3 hrs. The kit contains all of the enzymes and reaction buffers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btkf2","text":"required for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hdda","text":"1. enzymatic fragmentation to produce dsDNA fragments;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9kio","text":"2. end repair and A-tailing to produce end-repaired,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7ld1","text":"5'-phosphorylated, 3'-dA-tailed dsDNA fragments;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bce3t","text":"3. adapter ligation, during which dsDNA adapters with 3'-dTMP overhangs are ligated to 3'-dA-tailed molecules; and","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co58l","text":"4. library amplification (optional), which employs highfidelity, low-bias PCR to amplify library fragments","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"docp4","text":"carrying appropriate adapter sequences on both ends. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

To obtain a population of shorter or longer molecules, the protocol may be modified as follows:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"aha46","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["129","129","129","129"],"data":[["Upper size limit","Modification","Lower size limit","Modification"],["Increase","Decrease the ratio of the first cut","Increase","Decrease the ratio of the second cut*"],["Decrease","Increase the ratio of the first cut","Decrease","Increase the ratio of the second cut*"]],"guid":"79308CB06AE811EA9AD90242AC110004","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"60cb1","text":"* The second size cut should be performed with at least 0.2 volumes of KAPA cleanup beads reagent. Please note that the volume of KAPA cleanup beads needed for the second cut is calculated relative to the volume of the DNA at the start of the size selection procedure, not the volume of the DNA-containing supernatant transferred after the first cut. DNA recovery is dramatically reduced if the difference between first and second cuts is less than ~0.2 volumes. To increase the amount of DNA recovered, \u003e0.2 volumes of KAPA cleanup beads may be used for the second cut, but note that this may result in the recovery of smaller library fragments and/or a broader size distribution. For more information on double-sided size selection, please refer to the KAPA NGS Library Preparation Technical Guide (available on request from Technical Support at sequencing.roche.com/support).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Upper size limit","Modification","Lower size limit","Modification"],["Increase","Decrease the ratio of the first cut","Increase","Decrease the ratio of the second cut*"],["Decrease","Increase the ratio of the first cut","Decrease","Increase the ratio of the second cut*"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23],"show_headers":true}}}}

title: Appendix 1: Size Selection

If necessary, the protocol may be paused safely after completion of the Post-ligation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvsrd","text":"Cleanup (step 4.17; the end of the protocol for PCR-free workflows). Purified, adapter-ligated library DNA may be stored at 2Â°C to 8Â°C for 1 â€“ 2 weeks, or at -15Â°C to -25Â°C for â‰¤1 month before amplification, target capture and/or sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0fg","text":"To avoid degradation, always store DNA in a buffered solution (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0 â€“ 8.5) when possible,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mlpj","text":"and minimize the number of freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6upr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76rjf","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47ve0","text":"First-time users should refer to Appendix 2: Optimization of Fragmentation Parameters (p. 16)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d391i","text":"before trying this kit, as standard fragmentation parameters may not result in the optimal size distribution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e3d8e","text":"for libraries prepared from your specific DNA samples. Precious samples should not be used when evaluating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ht69","text":"this kit. Instead, parameters should be optimized with a non-precious, bulk DNA sample that is representative","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kl1v","text":"of the actual samples to be processed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hjpd","text":"If your DNA samples contain EDTA, please consult the Appendix 2: Handling of DNA Samples Containing EDTA (p. 16), as well as Important Parameters: Input DNA (p. 4) before starting this protocol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bor9u","text":"This protocol does not include size selection.
